description.en: The course is 100% web-based (in the Moodle). First, the students are introduced with the definitions of problem and problem-based learning. Next, different classifications of problems and related problem solving strategies are introduced and discussed asynchronously in a forum and synchronously in a webinar. After that, students design problem tasks and give feedback to their peer students about their problem tasks. Finally, a webinar for discussing problem tasks and main principles for applying problem-based learning will be organised. The course finishes with an examination in the form of an e-test.
description.et: Kursus on 100% veebipõhine (Moodle-i keskkonnas). Esiteks tutvutakse probleemi ja probleemõppe definitsioone. Järgmiseks tutvutakse erinevate probleemide klassifikatsioonidega ja nendega seotud probleemide lahendamise strateegiatega ning toimuvad vastavad asünkroonsed arutelud foorumis ja sünkroonsed veebinaril. Pärast seda disainivad õppijad probleemülesandeid ja annavad kaasõppijatele tagasisidet nende probleemülesannete kohta. Viimaseks toimub veebinar, mille arutatakse probleemülesandeid ja probleemipõhise õppe rakendamise põhiprintsiipe. Kursus lõpeb e-testi vormis eksamiga.

objectives.en: The course gives an overview about the definitions and classifications of problems and related problem solving strategies; in addition, problem-based learning and design and educational implementation of problem tasks is introduced.
objectives.et: Kursus annab ülevaate probleemi definitsioonidest, probleemide klassifikatsioonidest ja nendega seotud probleemide lahendamise strateegiatest, aga samuti probleemõppest ning selleks vajalike ülesannete koostamisest ja hariduslikust rakendamisest.

learning_outcomes.en: After completing the course, the student:
(1)	has general overview about the problem definitions and problem-based learning and common types of problems;
learning_outcomes.et: (1)	omab üldist ülevaadet probleemi definitsioonist ja probleemõppest ning probleemide enamlevinud liikidest;

learning_outcomes.en: (2)	has systematic overview about problem-solving phases and their relations;
learning_outcomes.et: (2)	omab süsteemset ülevaadet probleemide lahendamise etappidest ja nende omavahelistest seostest;

learning_outcomes.en: (3)	has skills to design problem tasks and knows main principles to apply them.
learning_outcomes.et: (3)	oskab koostada probleemülesandeid ja teab nende rakendamise põhilisi printsiipe.

independent_work.et:
1.	Reading course materials in Moodle and participating in relevant asynchronous and synchronous discussions.
2.	Designing problem tasks: two problem tasks of different types; description of strategies for solving these problems.
3.	Giving feedback to peer students about their problem tasks.
4.	Evaluating problem tasks of the peer students.

Guidelines are given in Moodle.

description.et:
The problem tasks will be evaluated by peer students (30% of points) and teachers (70% of points). The following criteria will be evaluated:
1)	accordance with the problem type (20%),
2)	quality of the problem task (30%),
3)	quality of the problem solving strategy (50%).
The sum of average scores of peers and teachers (30/70) will be used for the final score. They will get a mark:
A - 91-100% of maximum score
B - 81-90% of maximum score
C - 71-80% of maximum score
D - 61-70% of maximum score
E - 51-60% of maximum score
F (failed) - 50% or of the maximum score or at least one of the criteria is assessed 50% or less from the maximum.

The students fill in an online test that consists of three parts each representing one of the learning outcomes of the course. Students are allowed to use all materials available in Internet but not the help of peer students.
They will get a mark:
A - 91-100% of correct answers
B - 81-90% of correct answers
C - 71-80% of correct answers
D - 61-70% of correct answers
E - 51-60% of correct answers
F (failed) - 50% or less correct answers or at least one of the expected learning outcomes is not achieved at the E level.

grade_preconditions.et:
The problem tasks, feedback to peer students and evaluations of peer students' problem tasks have to be submitted before the examination.
The students have to participate in the online discussions about course materials.

grade_evaluation.et: Assessment is based on problem tasks (50%) and achievement test (50%). Both of them should be completed at least at E-level. The final score is based on the average of the scores in both assessment methods.

debt_elimination.et: According to the agreement with the teacher in charge, following the rules set in university's study regulations.

assessment_scale.et: Eristav (A, B, C, D, E, F, mi)
assessment_scale.en: differentiated (A, B, C, D, E, F, not present)
